topics_and_summary.preprocessing.ngrams module¶

topics_and_summary.preprocessing.ngrams.create_bigram_model(dataset: topics_and_summary.datasets.common.Dataset, min_count=50, threshold=75) → gensim.models.phrases.Phraser[source]¶

Returns a bigram model based on the documents in the dataset.

Parameters

  • dataset – Dataset.

  • min_count – Ignore all words and bigrams with total collected count lower than this value.

  • threshold – Represent a score threshold for forming the phrases (higher means fewer phrases).

Returns

Bigram model.

topics_and_summary.preprocessing.ngrams.create_trigram_model(dataset: topics_and_summary.datasets.common.Dataset, min_count1=50, threshold1=75, min_count2=100, threshold2=175) → Tuple[gensim.models.phrases.Phraser, gensim.models.phrases.Phraser][source]¶

Returns a bigram and a trigram model based on the documents in the dataset.

Parameters

  • dataset – Dataset.

  • min_count1 – Ignore all words and bigrams with total collected count lower than this value in the bigram model.

  • min_count2 – Ignore all words and bigrams with total collected count lower than this value in the trigram model.

  • threshold1 – Represent a score threshold for forming the phrases for the bigram model (higher means fewer phrases).

  • threshold2 – Represent a score threshold for forming the phrases for the trigram model (higher means fewer phrases).

Returns

Bigram and Trigram model. Both are needed to create trigrams.

topics_and_summary.preprocessing.ngrams.make_ngrams(dataset: topics_and_summary.datasets.common.Dataset, ngram_model_func: Callable)[source]¶

Applies the given ngram model function to the documents in the given dataset.

Parameters

  • dataset – Dataset where ngrams will be created.

  • ngram_model_func – Function where an n-gram model is accesed with the indexing operators []. It could be bigram, trigram, … Example of function: ‘lambda x: bigram_model[x]’ or ‘lambda x: trigram_model[bigram_model[x]]’.

topics_and_summary.preprocessing.ngrams.make_bigrams_and_get_bigram_model_func(dataset: topics_and_summary.datasets.common.Dataset, min_count=50, threshold=75) → Callable[source]¶

Creates a bigram model based on the documents in the dataset, makes bigrams in the dataset using that model, and returns a function that allows to obtain bigrams given a list of strings.

Parameters

  • dataset – Dataset to use to create the bigram model. The documents in the dataset are modified, creating bigrams with the previously created bigram model.

  • min_count – Ignore all words and bigrams with total collected count lower than this value.

  • threshold – Represent a score threshold for forming the phrases (higher means fewer phrases).

Returns

Function that receives a list of words and returns a list of words with possible bigrams, based on the bigram model trained in the given dataset.

topics_and_summary.preprocessing.ngrams.make_trigrams_and_get_trigram_model_func(dataset: topics_and_summary.datasets.common.Dataset, min_count1=50, threshold1=75, min_count2=100, threshold2=175) → Callable[source]¶

Creates a trigram model based on the documents in the dataset, makes trigrams in the dataset using that model, and returns a function that allows to obtain trigrams given a list of strings.

Parameters

  • dataset – Dataset to use to create the trigram model. The documents in the dataset are modified, creating trigrams with the previously created trigram model.

  • min_count1 – Ignore all words and bigrams with total collected count lower than this value in the bigram model.

  • min_count2 – Ignore all words and bigrams with total collected count lower than this value in the trigram model.

  • threshold1 – Represent a score threshold for forming the phrases for the bigram model (higher means fewer phrases).

  • threshold2 – Represent a score threshold for forming the phrases for the trigram model (higher means fewer phrases).

Returns

Function that receives a list of words and returns a list of words with possible trigrams, based on the trigram model trained in the given dataset.
